news.headline: Musk's next task? Reviving Tesla in Europe where sales have plunged by more than half in a year
news.summary: Tesla sales plunged by more than half last month in several European countries in a sign that Elon Musk could struggle to revive the company after he shifts from his Washington work to running the automaker again. news.headline: 'Keep Cutting 'Til The Screaming Starts'—Elon Musk Reportedly Shutting Down The Government Loan Office That Helped Tesla With $465 Million
news.summary: In a move that critics say could damage the future of American clean energy, Elon Musk is reportedly overseeing the dismantling of the Department of Energy’s Loan Programs Office—the very agency that helped launch Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) to the level where it is now with a $465 million loan back in 2010

news.headline: Elon Musk chose the 'right path' in recommitting to Tesla: Analyst
news.summary: In Tesla's (TSLA) most recent earnings call in April, CEO Elon Musk stated his intent to recommit himself to his electric vehicle company, expecting to spend less time in Washington, D.C. as head of the Trump administration's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). news.summary: Tesla is already using driverless technology to move vehicles from production lines to storage lots at its Texas facilities.
